headline: Constellation Brands, Oklo, AMD: Trending Tickers
summary: Josh Lipton and Hennion & Walsh chief investment officer Kevin Mahn take a closer look at some of Tuesday's trending tickers ahead of the closing bell. Bank of America analysts downgraded Constellation Brands (STZ) to Underperform from Neutral and initiated coverage of Oklo (OKLO) with a Buy rating, while Truist upgraded AMD (AMD). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Why Constellation Brands (STZ) Shares Are Sliding Today
summary: Shares of beer, wine, and spirits company Constellation Brands (NYSE:STZ) fell 3% in the afternoon session after a downgrade from Bank of America Securities, which lowered its rating on the stock to Underperform from Neutral and slashed its price target.

headline: BofA cuts Constellation Brands to Underperform on weak beer demand
summary: Investing.com -- Bank of America downgraded Constellation Brands to Underperform from Neutral and cut its price target to $150 from $182, saying beer consumption remains soft and the stock is still not cheap despite a 26% fall this year.

headline: Will Constellation Brands Recover After Canada's Alcohol Boycott Hits Shares?
summary: Thinking about what to do with Constellation Brands right now? You’re not alone. After all, this is a company that rarely fades from investor watchlists, but with the stock closing recently at $163.68 and down -26.5% year-to-date, it’s understandable to want perspective before making any moves. There’s no way around it; Constellation hasn’t just dipped. It has practically taken a nosedive over the past year, with shares off -30.3%. Even going back five years, the stock has lost -4.8%, which...
